page.title: 12Burringham Village.
page.content: Burringham village is built on the east bank of the River Trent. In it there are houses and bungalows which are quite new and older farmhouses and farm cottages. It also has a pub named The Ferryboat because it has been built on the site where a ferry used to go across the river. A road goes through the village and follows the river. The paths are very narrow in places. I do not think I would like to live there because you could easily get run over. Some of the houses have a small back garden with a bank at the back. Just over the bank is the River Trent. One of the houses has the date it was built on it. It was built in 1881 so it is 104 years old.
